content.description: Start on the two side pulls and figure out how to get to the crimp. Crux is standing on the sloper edge
content.protection: Cover up the boulder and the sharp rock behind you
content.location: Left of the large rock further inside

content.description: Edit: coming back I have noticed the starter block for Cut of your jib is starting to flex. keeping this post up to warn anyone who thinks about climbing itFrom the low angled feature, work into Cut of your Jib. There are a few intermediate slopers if you need them.

Edit: coming back I have noticed the starter block is starting to flex. keeping this post up to warn anyone who thinks about climbing it 

Lean back on the sidepull and work up the micro crimps to the top.
content.location: It is on the left side when you first walk into longboat

content.description: Start on a obvious Jug about chest height with a two hand match in the broke circle. Use a heel hook. Crux is getting going as the heel hook is awkward and needs a big right move. After that keep moving right with some fun movement swinging your feet over. Top out is actually good unlike most Classic SOMO top outs.
content.protection: I felt comfortable with a singe Crashpad but some might want a couple
content.location: Located furtherest back in the gap or on the left side when facing the wall. Look for the half broke circle. Solid two star route that good to warm up for a project or work into a circut.  Harder than the eye look. Originally thought this was going to V1. Brought 5-6 people to test it out and got confirmation that the crux move is in line with other v3 at SOMO.

content.description: Small left hand crimp and right hand crimp on a slightly angle side pull. There is a head height jug, do not use this for the start. Right foot up on a small ledge to the right. First move is a static move. Go left with some good crimps and some fun leg swings for better feet as you travel the bridge with your hands. Great top out. This crosses the broken helm.
content.protection: Felt good with one crashpad but some might want a second.
content.location: Located on the right side or first problem once you walked between the boulders. Originally though this was this was going to be a v1. If you go straight up it is v1 and boring.

content.description: This boulder contain two problems that create a great warmup circuit with Splitville. The route are located on on the inside between another rock feature. As you walk to the inside, you will notice the boulder looks like a viking longboat. The rock is classic hard dry granite.
